Description:
Supervising a maintenance crew.
Performing work tasks including those being carried out by those under his/her supervision.
Operating vehicles and equipment as assigned.
Operate the winch units in and out of the hole, zeroes tools and monitor tension meter, cable speed, depth and spooling of cable, understands depth control and weight indicator systems
Perform a variety of duties associated with the servicing of an oil or gas well and the maintenance and repair of equipment
Ensure a high quality of service by maintaining the equipment assigned to the cell in top working condition, in accordance with the base program and as directed by the Engineer
Actively promote Safety at wellsite, in the shop and within his community through making SOC cards and Quality Improvement ideas
Prepare well for service operation, align the logging unit, rig the sheave wheels and connect multiple tools as required
Identify the primary and secondary tools and associated equipment required to run all services in the country Assist the Engineer in the calibration and maintenance check of all tools and equipment
Operate the winch units in and out of the hole, zeroes tools and monitor tension meter, cable speed, depth and spooling of cable, understands depth control and weight indicator systems
Build bridles, head, torpedoes and rope sockets
Inspect, maintain and repair primary tools, service units, and associated equipment
Repair, maintain, rebuild and change cables
Clean, maintain and paint tools, doghouse and ancillary equipment both on and offshore
Report all malfunctions or suspected areas of trouble to the appropriate shop personnel and keep the Engineer informed at all times
Assist the Foreman in shop duties in liaison with the Field Engineer/Location Manager.Skills
Skills:
University (relevant degree) or Diploma (relevant degree) + 6 years working experience 
Certified as 10K PCE by IADC or equivalent
Knowledge of procedures/regulations on the transportation of dangerous goods (explosives/Radioactive Sources)
Understand depth control and weight indicator systems
Good interaction within crew members (engineers and operators)
